She gave me a to go box of dirty rice, fried chicken, collar greens and velvet cake for free. I think she did that because I told her it was my last night staying in Phoenix and that we didn't have soul food this good in the Bay Area.

Where to start? 

Let's start by addressing the false advertising on their website.  After hearing a few people talk about how good the food is there , we wanted to give it a try.  We viewed their website and if you look under Entrees, you will see the meals are all priced at $10.18 per plate.  Good deal! 

We arrive at the place and our first impressions are, the place needs cleaning and a paint job.  Most anyone can look past how a place looks if the service is great and the food is really good.  Most dive places I've been to have both... so the decor isn't something I get hung up on. 

Service...  marginal at best.  Some guy... guessing the owner... arguing with the staff, singing... just doing whatever.  I guess this is acceptable since he owns/runs the place?  Not the best thing to do in front of customers. (again... it's a dive... not expecting 5 star services)

Server---  stops my wife in front of the bathroom door to ask if she knows what she wants to order.  Maybe wait until we are all seated and ready to order?  Thought this was pretty strange! 

Now the food comes out.  Chicken wasn't horrible, wasn't great.  The canned mac-n-cheese... right up there with the best High School cafeteria mac-n-cheese.... not good!  Right from a box or can... no flavor... not homemade.   Very disappointing to say the least.  The greens... again... from a can... maybe some additional seasoning added... but.. odds are... if they were too lazy to make real mac-n-cheese... then they were too lazy to make real greens.  Gravy on the chicken... same sad story... from a box/can.... just not good or great. 

Dessert--- sweet potato pie   not bad... probably one of the better things ordered.  What was crazy... if you can imaging this... take a normal/decent size slice of pie... now cut that in half and this was the serving size we got.  All for $4.99 a slice. NUTS!  $10 for two slivers of pie. A joke! 

Remember I mentioned the FALSE ADVERTISING at the beginning of this review.  All meals $10.18.  NOT TRUE!  The site hasn't been updated in who knows how long? 

You sit down and the menu does not show the pricing... only mention of pricing is the Ox tales for $15.00.  So... you would assume from the website the meals are $10.18 each.  WRONG....  for  two meals, two very sad/small slices of pie.... $41.00 

No breakdown of the pricing ... the owner/manager just punched up some numbers on the calculator and that was the bill. 

All in all... this place needs new management... some passion put back in to  the kitchen... and they need to update/clean the place.  Not to mention... in this day and age... no excuses to not having an updated website.... to properly reflect your business and pricing.  I have a feeling when Mrs White was running this place... it was awesome... not anymore. 

Bad experience.. not even close to being worth the money spent. Avoid this place...save your money....

Will not be going back... will not recommend this place to anyone I know.

Okay here's an update. I've been back to Mrs. White Golden Rule. I can admit the food was becoming very inconsistent in its flavor but this weekend I had a veggie tray and it was done just right! Please keep whomever is back there... they have something right! This is the 2nd Sunday's that we've been blessed with this cooks exquisite fine cooking of soul food! As much as I'd love to give 5 stars, the cornbread is still lacking something but this minor setback won't stop me from visiting Mrs. Whites Golden Rule

As a die hard Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles fan, I was highly skeptical to try this place when my coworker raved about how good it was. So standards were set pretty high... we went for lunch on a weekday and I was prepared for a laid back atmosphere and probably not the fastest service but that "the food makes up for it". We ordered sweet tea and waited about 10 mins until another server came by and asked for our drink orders again. We both said we ordered the sweet tea and she responds "sure, I'll bring it out" to my surprise I get handed a regular unsweetened tea with SWEETENER PACKETS!!! What kind of sweat tea is this?! But I decide to not say anything and just wait for our food. So our food comes and we never receive the corn bread which is supposed to come with the meal so I'm just not very impressed at this point. Then ANOTHER server asks to refill our drinks and we say we had ordered sweet tea, SHE COMES BACK WITH SWEET TEA!!! Like where was this tea when I first ordered it and why didn't I get it???? Very disappointed in this place to say the least and I have to say that I make better greens than theirs tasted

A True Phoenix land mark for Soul-food. I've been coming here for almost 30 years. A lot of history here. Food is excellent, but service can be slow. I'm a Big fan of their smothered liver and onions. Catfish was also good, as was the chicken. If you enjoy Lo Lo's, try the original. (Lo Lo's Mama)

I'm a huge proponent of The Golden Rule. Ever since I was a little girl the words "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you" has resonated with me. Clearly, to Mrs. White The Golden Rule goes a step further to making truly delicious soul food.  The place is quaint and feels like you're sitting down to eat at somebody's home or at a church dinner.  There is simply no substitute for Mrs. Whites.  From the cornbread to the catfish everything is seasoned superbly.  Real soul food with real soul. Guaranteed.

Food: 5/5
I ordered the chicken fried steak. It was delicious, enough said. 

Service: 2/5
One person got their food within 15 minutes, the next couple got it 10 minutes later, and we finally got all of our food after an hour had passed. They are very slow at cooking. 

Atmosphere: 2/5 
It's kinda cool seeing the signatures.... but it's not great looking in there; kinda divey.

Waitress: 5/5
Doris was amazing. 

Value: 3/5 
A little pricey but not too outrageous. 

Overall I would say 4/5, definitely worth a visit for the food.

Proper southern food like fried chicken and fried pork chops. If you're someone who likes collard greens and okra and such, then you're home.

I went with the regular fried chicken, which was a good portion of three pieces, properly battered and very crispy. As good as any chicken I've had in the Southeast. The green beans were a little overdone but the mac & cheese was excellent. Firm, tangy, and some of the browned edges in my bowl. Yum!

I was a little worried that they were cash only, but yes, they *do* accept cards.

We came here to try what a soul food means and the outcome was tremendously great, exceed our expectation, this was 2 years ago and now we are back to Phoenix just to watch football game and heading back to California, and there is no way that we won't stop by at Mrs. White to grab something to munch..... This definitely complete our day specially the fried chicken and the banana pudding.... plus the amazing people that makes your day !!!

This chicken was awesome. It was pretty darn delicious. HOWEVER, the inside of the chicken, how disappointing... It taste like the chicken hadn't really had time to marinade? The skin was seasoned perfectly and crispy so I made sure to get a bite of that in with every piece of meat.

The mac-n-cheese, mushy and not very tasty. The potato salad, yums!! Very good on that mix. And the corn bread, how disappointing. It was dry and tasteless. I was really looking forward to it too because corn bread and soul food, hand in hand right?? Not so much here :-\

I wanted to try Lolo's up the street but I think they were closed for construction or something. For some reason I have a feeling that place would be more of what I was looking for.

It's a shame I'm not allowed to leave NO STARS because that is what this joint deserves.  Mrs. White's Golden Rule Cafe isn't "golden rule" at all because if this group of people came to my place, I'd feed them better and treat them friendlier then they ever did me. 

After the New Times Best of 2011 came out, this place won(!) and  I made note to visit the place soon and  the best it got all night were two female dishwashers, in the parking lot, smoking, who could not have been nicer with their welcome.

But that, my friend, is as good as it got.  The waitress, and calling her a waitress demeans all perfectly good servers across the valley, she would not get up from her seat at the counter to serve me!  She merely slid the menu across the counter to me and said, in a very unfriendly voice, whaddya havin'?

The owner sat behind the counter counting his money -- SERIOUSLY -- and bragged to no one listening how he'd seen the same Casino-B Act three times in a day the day before.  Wow.

The chicken came, it was good.  I paid $21 for a plate of fried chicken, all white meat, black-eyed peas and another memorable side I cannot recall.  They were out of mashed potatos.  HOW DO YOU RUN OUT OF MASHED POTATOES?  OH, WAIT, WATCHING A B-LIST CASINO ACT 3 TIMES IN A DAY MIGHT TAKE AWAY FROM KITCHEN PREP DUTIES, NO?!!!!!

I told my friend on the way home what a scam that was.  I said one original recipe whole breast from KFC would be as good or better.  We stopped at the next KFC...and I was right!  $2.47 for one whole breast from KFC vs. $21 --- PER PERSON! -- at Mrs. White's.  STAY WAY AWAY FROM MRS. WHITES!

This guy, this family should get down on their hands and knees, every night and thank God for Jerry Colangelo, the Diamondbacks and the gentrification of their neighborhood.  It allows, at least, a couple of casino shows per night!

The sycophants who've written before me must want to misinform you:

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.  I WASTED MY MONEY FOR YOU!

update 1/20/13-a private message from Tony accuses me of racism.  Really?  What did I say here that was racist?  That I didn't like the food?  That's not racist.  That's the food. That the owner was counting his money?  Again, not racism.  The only thing racist here is Tony.

The food here is VASTLY OVERRATED!  I'M TELLING YOU, EL POLLO LOCO has better chicken than this DUMP, by FAR!  And you don't have watch an extremely fat waitress refuse to get up...oh, wait.  She can't.  She's too fat.
Best fried chicken anywhere in Arizona and the service is great I will definitely be back here once a week

I kind of experienced some reverse racism here.. and it really pissed me off... yeah, I'm white.. doesn't mean I don't crave some great soul food once in a while.. thought the whole point of the golden rule was to leave your money on the table.. as I'm leaving.. dude asks me if i'm going to pay? tld him money was on the table...did'nt question any of the african american folk...  really ticked me off.. plus, cash only, real limited menu, no waffles, corn on the cob, mashed, really limited sides..and kind of mediocre IMO.. Staceys and lolos kick its ass... (Shrug)

We wouldn't have Lolo's if it wasn't for Mrs. White. This food is amazing and a Phoenix institution. Great chicken and feels like momma made it. But you know your momma can't cook so go here! Lol. Sides like homemade and dessert that you catch the itis from.

The pork chop and country fried steak were amazing.  The Mac n cheese was pretty special too.  I prefer my Mac n cheese to be really creamy and cheesy.  Their Mac was neither but just had a solid seasoned and cheese flavor.  The gravy was awesome.  I had rice and gravy also and I loved it. It's a must do.  Just don't look for soda.  You'll be drinking sweet tea or kool aid.  Great place!

I had been hearing about this place for a long time and since I was downtown with my wife decided it was time to have some fried chicken and black eyed peas. Just to let all of you know you can order healthy from the menu, which is written on the wall but really what would be the point of excusing you from the best fried chicken in Phoenix? 

The drink menu is not vast, 3 different drinks and that is it. I suppose the charm of the place is that, well, it is what it is, its a good eats in downtown phoenix that does not try to be anything else. Its not heart healthy but who wants to live forever and its not as it your going to make this a staple in your day to day eating.
Good food with piss poor customer service. Will not be returning or bringing my out of town guess.
The food was ok..the service was terrible. They forgot to bring out full order several times. The wait time to get their attention is ridiculous.

I would've given it a 5 if it was just based off the food. The food was delicious, no complaints about the food at all. The service was HORRIBLE, absolutely horrible. We waited about 15 minutes to even get acknowledged. They gave one of us tea instead of lemonade and waited about 10-15 minutes for them to bring us the lemonade. One of the people in my group only ordered Mac and Cheese. We all received our food but they didn't bring her Mac and cheese. We waited another 15 minutes and asked three different people for the Mac and cheese before receiving it. Also, two of the guests had a side of red beans that was not brought out with their meal. We asked all three employees at least 2-3 times for their red beans and rice. Finally one order was brought out but not the other. So then we had to wait even longer for the second order to come out. This was after asking another 2-3 times about the red beans. 
 If I ever eat here again, I'll see about calling ahead and ordering for takeout. Like I said, the food was delicious.. I ordered the vegetable plate and it was amazing. The service just made this a miserable experience though.
This place is really good. Had the fried chicken, sweet potatoes and Mac n cheese - everything was really good. When I am back in Phoenix again, I will be coming back.

The topic of Mrs Whites would frequently come up in the office place by a coworker who used to work near there, at the New Times. This past week though it came up quite often, often enough that on Monday, when we were planning our lunch out together for Thursday, we were so hungry by talking about Mrs Whites that it only took until shortly after 11 for us to pile in her car and head out for some good ol' soul food. 

I can't even begin to tell you how wonderful this place is. It's like walking into Grandma's kitchen and getting all those great meals you used to love and enjoy. My mouth was watering and my stomach was singing before I even had a chance to sit down. 

I like that all the meals are the same price. It makes it so much easier. I also like the selection of sides and dishes. The red kool-aid was delicious but not in a mason jar like Lolos.

The staff was very friendly. One of my coworkers was craving ox tail and it started a big discussion between us and our waitress. She mentioned that Mr. Larry might know when it was available again (they were apparently out of it that day) and he even came out to the table to talk to us. My friend also then got his ox tail. I tried it. It's really damn good. I'd probably order it if it was available the next time I came around.

I went for the 3 piece smothered chicken (fried chicken and gravy) and red beans and rice. Wow that is a lot of food. I devoured the chicken fairly quickly. It was delicious. Best friend chicken I've had aside from my Grandma's. The red beans and rice I had to package up and bring home. I had them for dinner tonight and they were just as delicious as I imagined. 

I also tasted one bite of the peach cobbler a la mode. Peaches are not one of my favorite fruits but damn did they do it right. 

If you haven't been here, it's a definite must. I'm not sure why you're still reading this. Pack up and go. Move it.
Fastest food I received. Literally I waited about 10 minutes for my food and it was hot and fresh. Food was delicious. Not overpriced.

On a spring break trip with our son who wanted fried chicken. We googled "best fried chicken in Phoenix" and this place was #1 on the local paper's "Top 10 Fried Chicken spots."  They weren't wrong. Chicken is succulent, tender and flavorful. I got the chicken fried steak which was so yummy. These people know what they're doing. Between us, we got the red beans, Mac salad, potato salad and Mac-n-cheese as sides. All were fantastic. It's small...maybe 12-13 tables. Basically, you feel like you went to somebody's house for the best, home cooked you've had in a long time.

Had the pork chops, which were very good.  Meat was tender and the gravy smooth and tasty.  Had the mixed greens and sweet potatoes for sides.  Greens were cooked well and spiced, the sweet potatoes melted in your mouth.
Good food, try it.

Hearty meals and very filling. I prefer baked mac, but all else is pretty good. My only issues is that they're always out of desert...it's like just take desert off the menu LOL. I'd say at least try them out!
Golden Rule is on point. If you're going to go on a Sunday (after church) be prepared fot a wait. Legit soul food in Phoenix.

looking for a modest dinner with a Louisiana bayou feel. Location was right downtown, the servers were a hoot and the food was amazing. The fried chicken was delicious with a crisp crust and moist and tender meat, the cornbread was cake like and the mixed greens and black eyed peas were the jewel on the plate ...great flavors all around.

Warning: this is not a fast food establishment. If you want cheap and greasy go to churches. 

This is the best soul food spot in the valley by far. Everything is made fresh to order. So you are going to have to wait for it to be made. In the meantime kick back, sip your sweet tea and take a load off while the talented chefs cook your food with love and the friendly waitress with the pretty smile pours you some more tea. The humble yet comforting atmosphere with all the great autographs are a great touch as well. If you want real soul food look no further. 

Slow down and eat, or go to Churches for mystery meat.
Could this have been any better?  Only if they came home with me and cooked for me everyday!

DE-LI-CIOUS!!

I was about to leave for a road trip from the Bay Area all the way to Dallas. Of course, I noted all these places I wanted to stop to eat along the way.

At the last second, I decided to watch the episode of "Best Thing I Ever Ate" in my DVR about fried chicken. Thank goodness I did!! Or else I would have never discovered this restaurant.

First off, they sell all their meals for $10.18 (plus tax). It comes with an entree and two sides. It's a HUGE plate of food. You could really eat it for two meals. The size of their drinks are monster, too. And for only $2.17! It'll make your plate full of food look small.

I went for their infamous southern fried chicken and sweet potato and green bean with potatoes for my sides. It was the best fried chicken I've ever had! There's just enough batter to chicken. The skin is crispy and the chicken is actually moist! I could pass on the green beans (they tasted like canned green beans), but the sweet potato was awesome. The sweet potato had just enough sweetness, but you have to ignore the (possibly heart stopping) liquid it sits in. Sometimes it better not to know how some stuff are made. =P

My hubby tried their chicken fried steak with rice and gravy and potato salad. The chicken fried steak has a flavorful, thick batter but it's still crispy. It totally looks homemade. The rice is your standard stuff, but the potato salad is yummy. 

They're open 7 days a week, but they close early at 7PM, so plan an early dinner! But on Fridays and Saturdays they reopen at 9PM for their Late Night Munchiez session. It's a different menu and made up of burgers, wings and other good late night munchies. 

Come here for the chicken first though. You won't be disappointed!

My sister and brother-in-law suggested we try this place for a to-go order of fried chicken. Although it took a bit to figure out what menu item/items were best for the occasion, everyone I spoke to was just AMAZING. It goes without saying that the chicken was delicious but the reason I give this place five stars is more about the people. Service with a smile, for sure! Thank you, Mrs. Whites!
Terrific soul food!  They were out of chicken.  So we have to come back.  This pic is what the table should look like when you're done!

Food is 5 star, if I could give service a minus I would so combined a 2. My wife and I are frequent diners here going back over 20 years and when we went on Wednesday April 11th it was the worst service ever people that came in at least 10 minutes after us were served and almost done eating before we got food. If not for the fact that I know how good the smothered pork chops are I would have walked out.

Interesting concept of customer service. No refills, didn't ask if we needed anything, didn't even ask how our meal was. Couldn't get the orders correct. Potato salad has to be store bought, tastes like Resers. The cabbage and greens were bland. Disappointing because they have a decent reputation.,

Thoroughly enjoyed my meal. This place is the real deal Holyfield, of you want some soul food with some soul. Courteous and prompt attention, my food was out on less than 10 minutes. Had the smothered chicken, greens and Mac and cheese. My compliments to the chef! Will be back to try other items such as the pork chop, chicken fried steak and meatloaf.

Best Fried Chicken I've ever had. I pass by this place every day when I go to work and I've been dying to try it. Came in yesterday with my bf for dinner. We both got sweet tea (which wasn't sweet enough in our opinion, but we've been spoiled by South Carolina sweet tea) but it was still good. 

I got the Fried Chicken plate with sweet potatoes and mac n cheese, he got the pork chop plate with green beans and coleslaw. When it came out, the chicken was still crackling from being taken out of the fryer. I had to wait for it to cool down, so I dug in to the sides. The sweet potatoes were delicious and the mac n cheese was so good. I tried a bite of the pork chops and almost thought I had made a mistake in ordering the chicken since they were that amazing. The coleslaw was also excellent in it's vinegar-y goodness.

But then I tried the fried chicken...and went to heaven. I couldn't stop eating it. Finger-lickin' good. They gave me a huge serving so I took the leftovers home and had them for dinner tonight. Normally leftovers don't heat up well, but these were an exception. All that remains of my dinner yesterday are the chicken bones and cravings for more. I will be back soon!

This has got to be my worst experience in any type of restaurant or cafe ive ever been to... i brought my family today at 1230pm and decided to leave at 3:10pm because we didnt get served and we saw atleaast 4 families get served and we had got there before them. We waited 2 and a half hours to not get serviced and wasted our whole sunday afternoon in this establishment...im not the one who usually complains but this was fucking ridiculous and felt i had to complain to what we experienced today.

Went back today and took out another 10 vehicles as I rammed into the left lane to make the turn into the lot...
I meant to try pork chops, or catfish...nope, I couldn't get past the chicken.
Once again, this chicken did not disappoint.  I had an annoying end to this long work day when I got home with this chicken.  But as soon as I picked up the drumstick and took a bite, it ALL washed away...seriously.
Let's back up.  
When I opened my styrofoam container, I noticed that the chicken had gotten slightly moist from the being closed up for almost an hour after I got it.  I thought the experience was going to be lessened.  No.  
The drumstick was a bit soggy on the bottom from sitting so long, but like I said, I bit into it and all the annoyances of life went elsewhere and bothered some other guy.
Perfection.
Even when soggy.
Even when sitting for over an hour.
If fried chicken remains absolutely delicious even after all that, you know you've got some special stuff.
What gets me is that I saw some young folks in the kitchen, I don't know if either of them fried the chicken, but if so - someone has been teaching them the real deal.  This tastes like some old woman who has been through years of hurt and pain but also joy and love has cooked this.  Someone who KNEW what bad chicken was and KNEW how to avoid that at all costs.  Someone who cared what their food tastes like.  And if youngens' are producing this kind of fare, that deserves proper kudos.
I notice there is not a 'professional' atmosphere here.  Like another reviewer said, anything seems to go.  
Honestly?  So what.
The food is too friggin good.  Yes, we are entitled to good customer service as customers.  But like I said before, you get what you put in with the people here.  You come in with an attitude, that is what you get.
I know some people put a high high value on customer service and how staff presents themselves; I do, too.  But chicken THIS good, and I mean specifically THIS chicken that is THIS good...I can accept the very casual atmosphere here.
Yes, I wish they would put a bit more pride in their professionalism.  
But I promise you, this chicken will make lovers of fried chicken not give a flying flea's fanny about anything else.  In each experience I've had with it, the chicken is THAT good.

This is the worst place I have ever came to eat! Honestly I don't care about the food tasting "good" when the service is horrible! Ide rather pay for mediocre food and have friendly non racist servers! My husband and I came in (he's black im Mexican) and the server right away just told us to sit down anywhere and came to get our drink orders soon after two more people came in after and she took their order first!!! Left us hanging! It wasn't until I told My husband what she had done that he got her attention and had to yell across the room that we were ready to order she right away looked at my like she knew what she did . She came to take our order and took my husbands first and then I ordered and she pretended i didnt say anything! She said "are you going to get your order?!" With and attitude I responded I had just told her my order she responded with a oh I couldn't hear you! And the food took forever to come out! Honestly I could care less about the food after all this crap! I wish yelp had a negative star review!

I came here years ago before a lady Gaga concert (great show). It was empty when we walked in and we ordered some drinks. We ordered our food and it took literally 2 hours for it to come out. There was no one in the resturant so I don't know why it took so long. I think whoever was working left. I won't come back here

If you crave good ,and I do mean scrumptious,  authentic Southern comfort food, Mrs . Whites is the place to go.  The Southern fried meal is mouthwatering and you cannot go wrong with your choice of two sides...save room for desert....family homey atmosphere. ..great service...wonderful and friendly staff...am definitely Coming back next time I am in Town!

This is a tough one.  I'd found out about Mrs. White's by way of Lo-Lo's, and thought I'd try Mama's food before Son's.  It was good, I'll say that.  I had the smothered chicken and regretted it immensely - fried chicken covered with gravy amounts to a mess of watery breading.  Between that and having to dig through the mess to find the bones, it wasn't exactly a lot of meat down my throat.  Mac & Cheese and white rice as my sides were good.

The ambiance?  There IS none.  I found more entertainment from the writing on the wall, which had clearly been painted over MANY times since the 60s, and the open/close sign which reads, if closed, to contact "Jesus".  LOL.

Unaware of the church across the street, I arrived right after Sunday services to find the place fairly full - some churchgoers, at least one newcomer party, and several regulars.  Based on the caloric content of the entrees, I wasn't surprised to see about 50% obese customers, while the rest were inexplicably thin.

As a Whitey, I can't say that I was comfortable.  Clientele is almost all Black and while they are some of my best friends, I only felt welcome because of the cordial words spoken by our waiter and the cashier at the checkout, who clearly could have beat the crap out of me with one punch.  Other than that, there were a lot of "what are YOU doing here?" looks from fellow customers.  I kept wishing I had brought my sista friend with me, who would have loved this place.

I'd go back, but it's not a perfect choice.  Perhaps on a Saturday when church hadn't just let out.  Also, the price is extreme - it's almost as high as Knott's Berry Farm which gives you more food for only about $2 more, and that's at theme park prices.  This is just dumpy outskirts of downtown..but again, I don't wanna judge.  I love small business and I'm proud of Mrs. White for making it this long; hope she continues for a long time to come.

Another great trip to Mrs. White's!  Had the southern fried chicken with mixed greens and Mac n cheese.  Everything was fresh and crispy. Chicken was crunchy but not greasy and the greens, well they were phenomenal!!!  Mac n cheese is always creamy but not runny like some. Washed down with a great glass of red kool aid and I drove home drowsy!!!  
Thanks again to the staff!!!

Go there for the food, not the ambiance.  I am an expert on Chinese restaurants so no problem for me!

Four drunk conventioneers decided on a Wednesday night in August to do Soul Food.  Two starched white guys both formerly from Texas made the suggestion.  One black dude formerly from South Carolina, and me a Hong Kong Chinese who grew up in Detroit.  Quite a foursome.  We stumbled into this place near downtown while the sun was still up.  Very spartan diner with counter and a few tables.  Sharpie autographs on the wall from the famous to the not so much.  It was near closing time because we ordered and ended up being the only ones in the place when food arrived in a trickle.  I had the fry chicken with collar greens and mac cheese sides.  Wonderfully crunchy and moist inside chicken.  Sides were perfect just like my childhood friend's Mom use to make.  My buds went for the steak fried chicken and two had the fried pork chops.  I only need to say that all plates where cleaned out.  No booze.  The ice tea had me worried, but I was told its made from Phoenix's famous tap water which is full of minerals.  The was the only downside.  Don't know but if they are okay with BYOB, If so, I will return someday from San Francisco.  Recommend this place if you need a soul food fix near downtown.  Close early around 8 pm.
Mrs White's Golden Rule Cafe- Was Great.

Who's got the munchies!!!!! Friday and Saturday nights till 3 am, Mrs. White's is servin' up some yummy munchies including Fried Zucchini around $3 and entrees for $13.  I had to have their fried chicken , pork chop and some gravy and rice at 12am! The fried chicken was cooked perfectly.  The skin is crispy and tasty.  The meat moist and tasty.  The portions are huge and you will not go home hungry.  The staff is friendly and helpful; always a pleasure to talk to them.  Skip Filibertos or Jack n' Box after the party..movie..concert..and go to Mrs. White's!

The most amazing soul food I've had in AZ yet!! The fried chicken was perfect and not made until it's ordered, Mac and cheese was homemade and incredible and the cobbler....delicious!!! The best part, kool-aide was one of the drinks available. You get TONS of food for not a lot of money. It is absolutely worth at least one trip to try it for yourself!!!

This place looks as plain as the food tastes. I could get a 3 piece meal at KFC with a drink for half the price of what  I paid for lunch here. 14.00 vs 7.00....

Just because it's homemade doesn't make it better....

The only thing good here was the Coleslaw (taste like KFC).

Keep your money and move on. There are plenty of places besides this one that serve much better food and service it's just not Mrs Whites :-(

Stopped in on a whim after a friend in my car said that she had been dying to try this place for the longest. We figured that we had a couple hours before we had to be anything to do, so we might as well stop in for a lunch.

We walked into the old restaurant and the first thing I noticed were the walls; they had signatures of famous celebrities, artists, and athletes who had stopped by for food scrawled in every corner of the place. There were only two other patrons in the place at 2pm on a Wednesday, so service was snappy and quick. 

We were waited on by a couple waitresses who were pleasant and recommended us different dishes. I ended up getting the country fried steak and my friends both ordered the famous fried chicken. You get a couple sides with each order, and I figured I wouldn't forgive myself if I didn't give their sweet tea a try. No more than 10 minutes later, our food came out and the portions were HUGE. My friends got three gigantic pieces of chicken each, and my steak seemed bigger than my face. We have a ton of black eye peas and mac & cheese scooped onto each of our plates; even the sweet tea came in a bigger-than-normal glass!

None of us came close to finishing our plates. The food was tasty and we were definitely happy that we stopped on by. The plates are a little expensive at $13, but the ridiculous portions more than make up for that. I would definitely come back again (next time, I'll have to try the catfish and okra gumbo).

Three words: Incredible Fried Chicken!

Just visited this place for the first time and the food is amazing.  It's only a block from Chase Field where the Diamondbacks play and they were open until 7:00 pm on the Wednesday that I visited.  I visited in the afternoon around 3:30 and it wasn't busy.  There were three or four people at the counter and one guy in a booth.  I grabbed a booth (very comfy by the way) and was served right away.  

Their menu is very basic  (main dishes, side dishes & desserts).  I ordered the Fried Chicken dinner, which comes with two sides (described below).  My beverage: a lemonade.  They don't have soda at this restaurant, which was a bummer, but the lemonade is tasty - not too tart, not too sweet.

The fried chicken is the best I"ve had in town.  The meal comes with three juicy pieces of mouth-watering chicken and the flavor is the best I've had in valley.  This isn't fast food fried chicken.  This is fried chicken your mama would make.  Yummy!

One of my sides was green beans with potatoes.  I've never had this combination of vegetables together before and it was really tasty.  I think the green beans were from a can but I'm not sure about the potatoes.  Regardless, this was a nice side dish.  I put a little pepper on it and I was good to go.

My other side dish was rice with gravy.  I guess I'm new to soul food because I've never heard of this combination before either.  The rice they use is excellent.  I'm not sure what it was but it had a better flavor than Uncle Ben's rice.  Some kind of gravy is mixed with the rice and the two together gave me a whole new yummy experience. 

I couldn't finish the whole meal and had to get a to-go box.  If I hadn't been so full I would have loved to try their dessert of the day, peach cobbler.  

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to people.  It's really close to downtown Phoenix and the ball park and the food is made with a lot of love, just like Mom would make.
This is the best comfort food you will ever have !!! The smothered chicken is the bomb - and the cornbread is the best

Went on the 4th of July with only 5 others in the shop.  Beware on the one way road in front of the cafe, my GPS had me driving down the wrong way!

The staff was friendly and amazing that all entree dishes were $11.  Ordered the pork ribs and links with sweet potatoes, came with corn bread and ordered sweet tea.  The meat fell of the bone and the links were spicy.  The sweet potatoes were sweet and yummy and the greens, not too salty.

The staff was friendly and attentive and the owner's son owns LoLo's Chicken and Waffles. http://www.yelp.com/biz/lo-los-chicken-and-waffles-phoenix#hrid:KN-j7PyAgt4EGCnjUMCHTQ

A colleague and I had lunch here recently.  We were both confused when the 'sandwich' he ordered off the menu was brought out; the fish was breaded but no sliced bread (explains why I didn't rate it 5 stars.  Really it's more like 4.5 stars).  Apparently the fish was good though!  I'd ordered the smothered pork chops with black eyed peas and coleslaw for sides.  To use Guy's terminology, both the chops & the gravy were "On point!".  The same could be said for the coleslaw ~ it had a great kick to it!  The peas were good, but not outstanding (can you make them outstanding?  I'm not so sure.).  Will be returning with The Boyfriend to try other options.  

And have more of that coleslaw.

Been wanting to try Mrs. Whites for some time with all the great reviews. Very friendly folks with super service was a plus but sadly the food was just ok and not worth the price. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak which was tender and had a nice light coating of Gravy. It was good but not great and lacked a little flavoring or at least some salt. For sides I opted for the green beans with red potato and the Mac and Cheese. The Green Beans were directly from a can with the same juice with a crushed red potato, again no flavor or spice, really? The Mac and Cheese was a huge disappointment having had better at a Walmart Deli. I wish my phon battery was not dead as the tiny slice of stale cornbread made me chuckle, exactly 1 inch by 1.5 inch. :)  $15.86 for a lackluster meal is not what I was expecting nor would I go out of my way to go back, even to see the happy waitress.

A great family business run by great people. I walked in late tonight to try and get some dinner to go only to find the business was closed. However the owner (I am assuming) came to the door and asked what I wanted and then invited me in and saw that I was able to get my food still. A really classy thing to do when she could have just said they were closed for the evening and my food was still fresh and amazing. You won a customer for life in my book :).

Oh my god.

Seriously.

The fried chicken is so light and crisp, I thought this dead bird was going to fly right off my plate.

The collard greens--you'll want to slap someone for serving you greens that didn't taste like this.  They are a gift from on high, and the black eyed peas are insanely good.  Redolent with pork and seasoning, they trump any black eyed pea you have ever had.  

Cornbread is grilled and isn't the dry, crumbly, cakey crap some places have the gall to give you, and the macaroni and cheese is soupy, cheesy and perfectly cooked, just like you wanted.

I saw plates literally overflowing with smothered pork chops and chicken, and if I hadn't been full to the point of a coma after eating all the chicken and greens and mac and cheese I could hold, I would have ordered some.  Or catfish.  Or neck bones.  

Desserts offered by one of the ladies who cooks walking through the dining room going "Who's gonna have peach cobbler?".  Who??? ME!  That's who!  Peach cobbler...are you kidding?  Do people say no??

Meals are ONE PRICE, period, ($10.18 with two sides and cornbread)and you better bring cash.  The lemonade was excellent ($2.37).


Oh my god, what wouldn't I have given to be a cow, with four stomachs.  It's worth going back to Phoenix for.  Stop here before you drop off your rental car.  You'll thank me.  So will your cardiologist.

The chicken was good and fresh off the frier. The workers were friendly but had to mention that our waitress needs a little "waitressing etiquette".  I asked her if the okra gumbo is spicy and she replied that she doesn't know 'cause she doesn't eat the stuff!

Great southern fried chicken! 
Simple menu with standard options.
I ordered the regular chicken plate with black eyed peas and mac n cheese. 

Can't wish to go again!

Mrs. Whites....
Mrs. Whites....

I. WOULD COMMIT A CRIME FOR THOSE COLLARD GREENS

2. Fried chicken... I dug the remnants out from under my finger nails and ate them...

3. Red beans and rice. Damn.

Old school feel, old school food, better than than any new school BS that some yuppie is eating at his local vegan restaurant.

Be bad and order some good.

Get the Golden Rule.

First off I would like to punch the dip Shit on the food network who said this was the best chicken he ever ate. Yeah the place is filthy, but how they operate their business is redicolus. Service sucks, 49 minute wait for the food sucks, waiting 20 minutes from the first  entree being dropped off until the last person luckily receives their food sucks, being told on the 59th minute of a hour wait for your food, that they are out of your side dishes, sucks, spending my hard earned money at a place that is Ass backwards in any kind of business sense, sucks. At first our group thought it was a joke, then the reverse racism theory was brought up, then we noticed that every table was experiencing the same lack of service. Black, white, purple,orange. They just sucked.

This place charges $15 a PLATE for a meat and two sides....that would be fine if it were in a comparable location and somewhere you wouldn't mind eating in...instead the place is dirty, old and they charge for EVERYTHING....debit card usage - there's a charge for that (which is illegal)..if you specify which pieces of chicken you would like instead of what they give you - that's a extra charge...if you use the ATM machine located inside etc....

The food itself is BLAND...in case anyone hasn't noticed, the candied yams and greens are from a can - called GLORY, yes you too can have this at home, the gravy is bland and lack seasonings...if you get red beans and rice - there's your 2 sides...it's not a combo like one would expect.

Overall the chicken and anything else here fried is great, but the box mix cornbread (May be Jiffy but it taste like Glory also) and "urban" decor is a no-go. If you spend $50 for 2 ppl to eat (which you will here if you get a drink) you're better off going for a descent steak dinner instead.

I'm sure these folks have remained in business due to the businesses in the surrounding area and "other" folks that don't know what true soul food tastes like (see Amera's review lol) so they are more than happy to hand over their money and call it THE BEST THING EVER...But Mrs. White and her friends/family (whoever works the place) would be laughed out of other authentic soul food/Southern areas of the country..

This is the equivalent to Taco Bell serving Mexican Food and calling themselves Carolina's.
The best breaded catfish ever, collard greens were on point  and the corn bread was real corn bread. Fried chicken was a little to over fried for my taste but the chicken itself was great

This is nice hole in the wall with a lunch counter place. The menu is solid soul food. The mixed greens and sweet potatoes were ok but that cornbread was great!! I wanted the cabbage but it wasn't ready when I ordered :(. The fish that I tasted on my friend's plate could have used more seasoning. Rice and gravy needed more seasoning too. If I ever come back to Phoenix, which I probably won't I would try a different restaurant. But if you are close to airport and want some soul food this a place to try out.

Stopped into Mrs. White's Golden Rule the first time in a few years. This local joint has been a staple in Phoenix since 1964!!  I use to stop in here several times a year when working in the downtown area. 
Today I opted for the same dish I use to always get: Catfish, rice w/gravy, and green beans w/ potatoes.  Just as good as I remembered and what I was hoping for.  Portion sizes are smaller than they once were but are now a perfect portion size for a full meal. Catfish had a good crunch with the fish still being moist and tender. The gravy could use some more salt & pepper but the green beans with potatoes were great. 
Decor wise: this restaurant is about as simple as it gets. Plating is also simple but has improved over the years. The real star here is the food as it should be. Highly recommended this Phoenix staple when in the downtown area.

My wife & I only ate here once but it was disappointing in comparison with all the high accolades given. While the service & pricing was fine, we were not nearly so impressed with the quality of the food. I certainly would not rate it to be poor, but it was nothing worth repeating. We both felt it was just typical diner quality food. The fried chicken was similar to eating Church's. Sorry folks, I have no desire to return.

Went here for a late lunch before the Diamondbacks game.  Despite it being close to 2:00 PM, it was pretty busy. The waitstaff was very friendly, but overall I found them to be quite slow and inattentive.  We were waiting for what seemed like an eternity when one of the waitresses (not the one who took our order) quipped "Are y'all movin' in or what?".  She immediately went to check on our order and brought it out a couple of minutes later. I had the fried chicken with macaroni and cheese and green beans as the sides. My companion had chicken fried steak with mac/cheese and black eyed peas.  We both agreed the food was OUTSTANDING.  Kick up the service a couple notches and I will gladly give this place 5 stars.

Went back to Mrs. White's for lunch yesterday.  The food is to die for, best fried chicken this side of the Mississippi, & the Mac & Cheese melts in your mouth.  What I love just as much is the friendly staff, they remember your face, make sure you feel welcome & go out of their way to make sure your food is right.  We took 2 people who had never been there before with us & both said they can't wait to go back again.  Do not head there if you are in a hurry, good food & good friends take time. This is not upscale froufrou food, this is good for the SOUL food, like eating dinner at your best friend's (or Gramma's) house!

This is old school food in an old school building. You can almost glimpse the Phoenix of days gone by and it kind of makes you feel good to know something has withstood the test of time and the rush to make corporate eateries seem small time local (Postinos, the Yard etc.) This place is small time local and you can tell from the food and service.

Key things to note:

Menu is heavy southern fare - so come hungry
Entrees are $13-15 including 2 sides
Sandwiches are around $6 and have one side
No alcohol
Credit cards accepted
You follow the golden rule and honestly report what you ordered when you pay
They close at 7pm

My friend and I opted for sitting at the counter. Only complaint is the chairs were horribly uncomfortable. Being closer to the kitchen and staff you could see this is a family place and everyone takes care of each other. Staff was very pleasant. Bridget took good care of us.

Both our main dishes were delicious. One catfish and one fried chicken. The green beans were good as was the mixed greens. 

I read some of the bad reviews on this place and most seem unfair or specific to one encounter. Do not go into this place expecting glitz or a modern slick feel that so many "hip" restaurants in Phoenix have of late. This is a family run establishment that serves old fashioned food. Respect who they are and what they are doing and you'll have a good experience. If not, go wait 3 hours for a pizza at Bianco's down the road.
The food was great! The seasoning on the chicken was superb. The fried okra is good and the Mac n cheese is very rich and creamy. The chicken is good both smothered and classic.

THE best of everything, their chicken is not like any other, everything is to die for.
Their tea is freshly brewed, sweetened and unsweetened, their beans and rice are amazing.  It is across from CHASE FIELD, they have autographed ceilings, floors and walls, you never know who will show up.  It closes at 1:00p.m, so, get there early.

My wife loves soul food.  When I brought her to Mrs. White's, she was sold.  The atmosphere was small and felt quite authentic.  We sat and ordered fried chicken.  I had Kool -aid (red), which I have not had since I was a kid.  I forgot how delicious the red concoction was.  About 40 minutes later, our fried chicken platters came out.  My wife first said "We could have split one"  ("No we could not...get your own" I thought to myself).  The chicken was divine.  My wife magically ate all three pieces by herself.  She believes that her hands grew a mind of their own and force fed her all 3 parts, but we know better.  She raved about how delicious everything was.  I liked the chicken a lot.  The only thing that would have made the place a bit more authentic would have been some jazz or blues playing in the background.  OK, the place was fine.  Not fancy or frilly.  In fact, you can pull out a pen and leave your mark on the wall as many others have.  Try it.  Its worth the drive downtown.

I picked up to-go orders today for myself and my co-workers.  I have worked in down town PHX for almost 20 yrs and missed this nice place until now.  This is the first time any of us tried the food.  We all enjoyed the it, we had the pork chops and the chicken.  We loved the cabbage and the cornbread as well.  The employees here were happy and they had great customer service, and made you feel welcome. All the girls want to start ordering from here now.

This place is so cool! The menus are on the walls in sharpie along with signatures from a lot of local athletes. They will not present a bill to you, but rather trust you to tell them what you ordered and pay the correct amount. The food is great, artery clogging, and comes in huge portions. I like the smothered chicken with yams and green beans, and order it every time. I always want to sleep off the rest of the day too. Saturday they do a great rib plate. Good spot for those working or living in the city.

Well I have not been here in a while. One thing I do remember about my last visit was when you're food is ready. They would not remember to  bring the corn bread until you have eaten you're meal. I remember it took about 20minutes for you're food to be ready. This time it was about 5 min. I was shocked ut came so quick.

I see the price has went from $10.00 to $13.00. I notice the portions have decreased. 
The greens lack season per a black operated establishments.

Season the CALLARD GREENS my people.
keep enough corn bread cook.
I heard the cooks were out. 

One is having a child. The other cook is out of town.
Now Carlos was on his job trying to make sure everyone he served was happy.

It shows in the flavor somebody missing.

saw these guys on best thing i ever ate...and now i know why...heres my review,..
Cornbread...excellent
Fried Chicken...great
mac and cheese...great
potato salad....great 
service....fantastic...i mean really good...the hostess was a sweetheart...she greeted me with a smile and sat me right away...brought my drink and the cornbread immediately and the entree within 5 minutes...i was very pleased with my experience

Tried for first time today after hearing a lot about it and seeing in local TV show.  Not at all impressed -- probably won't go back.  Chicken ok.  Pork chop overcooked and dry.  Rice and gravy bland.  I understand that the place is 50 years old but it really needs an overhaul. Floor, seating and all.  Bathroom definitely needs updating.

Great food. Good prices. Friendly service.

My friends and I ate here while attending the Phoenix Comicon not knowing anything about the place. We were pleasantly surprised. We weren't expecting soul food, but the chicken fried steak smothered in gravy and side of green beans hit the spot. 

Don't let the appearance of the building fool you (the windows are all barred up), the food is great.

I'm not sure what is worse; ordering my food to go, eating fried chicken, eating fried chicken in the heat, or all of the above. 

Well, rain or shine, I love eating Fried Chicken and nobody can take that away from me. So I saw this little bungalow-like restaurant, which is located a block away from Chase Field and also not far from my hotel, that serve authentic Southern and Soul food. But my dining experience and decision-making has costed me my hopeful solid meal.

I ordered the Fried Chicken dinner-combo for $12.00. The combo includes two sides with a slice of cornbread and I chose Rice and Mixed Collard Greens. I made a big mistake and opted to take my meal to-go to stuff my face with the fried chicken like a barbarian in my hotel room. My side of Collard Greens were very tasty and full of flavor, but a bit too watery, in which caused my side of rice to taste like a soup-like side and my monster-pieces of fried chicken's crispy skin and piece of cornbread were soggy. The fried chicken were very tasty, but it would've tasted a lot better if it wasn't for my misfortune. 

This restaurant accepts only cash. I should've ate in the restaurant, because the friendly workers treated me very well and strongly convinced me to eat in. I'll definitely will eat in the restaurant  next time.

The restaurant has numerous awards from various sources including having the famous Yelp-sticker posted on the front door. The restaurant is also a favorite of the NFL's Arizona Cardinals, and NBA's Phoenix Suns with numerous pictures posted all over the facility.

Food was awesome! Fried chicken was crispy and not at all greasy. Cabbage was a little sweet which was different but good. Sweet potatoes were just sweet enough. Mixed greens were delicious! Chicken fried steak was awesome! Smiling tummies all around. Carlos and Doris were so nice and took such good care of us. Definitely recommend for a great dining experience!!

I'm not going to complain that it's not a 5 star restaurant, but I figured that a Soul Food restaurant across from the oldest Black Church in Phoenix had to have good soul food! Catfish is my weakness and this place has it! Delicately fried and moist and tendered on the inside. It was perfection. I had it with mixed greens and Southern sweet tea. My Soul food cravings were more than satisfied! I WILL be back again and again!

The staff is sloven and lazy. I waited 15-20 minutes to check out. The wall is covered in magic marker graffiti. The food was blah. If I was a homeless man starving and someone offered me dinner here I would refuse. Dirty floor. And bland food. They must be a place where people go once WHILE ATTENDING A DBacks game . Never again. NEVER. At most I would order a coconut and a hammer, provided they touched neither. Soulless food served slowly. Oh and the tea was rancid. From a couple days earlier. Nastiness reigned.

First time here. Literally everyone that came in after us got their food before us. There were a few of them who actually were able to get their food and eat it all before we were served. It was freezing and I wouldn't not recommend coming here. The food is good, but not good enough to sit around for an hour and a half while everyone around you gets there food before you. Also they were out of like half our their menu which is only like 6 items.

I really liked this place! The food was incredible. Chicken was hot and crispy and fresh...my son missed his drumsticks but he ate everything. Macaroni and cheese was creamy and sharp...cornbread fresh and hot out of the oven! The best cabbage EVER!!!! How can simple cabbage be soooo good? Greens were tasty and not over cooked. We didn't have room for dessert but I loved that it was free on Sundays! Service was polite and attentive. It's worth the wait if you love fried chicken. Lots of folks ordered pork chops too!

I've been here a couple of times and the food has been great. The chicken is fired just right and is so juicy and tender. The mac and cheese is delicious. Their sweet tea hits the spot. My only gripe here is the decor off the place. It's looks like it could be spruced up a bit.

The 2 times we have gone there, they were closing.. What type of restaurant has soul food hours from 10:00-7:00? The average person gets off work at 5:00, that means you only have about a hour to get over there and eat. I will not be going back...ever.
Seems they got their AC fixed. Nice and cool inside. Server was so nice and polite; chicken was as amazing as always.

This is the first five star rating I've given on Yelp.  I have never had anything there that I didn't absolutely love.  Do not be fooled by cheap imitations (Lolo's...oh please!); nothing compares to Mrs. White's.  

Main courses:  their chicken fried steak is the best I've had and the smothered pork chops are excellent as well....extremely moist and flavorful.  

Side dishes:  I am a fool for their mac and cheese.  Mac and cheese is probably my all time favorite food and Mrs. White's is the best I have ever put in my mouth.  I also love the fact that they serve rice and gravy as a side dish.  The green beans are delicious (I rarely say that about a vegetable).  The greens are fantastic. 

Dessert:  Their peach cobbler is the first dessert I've eaten there and I won't try anything else because I would gladly eat my way out of a vat of their peach cobbler.

The ambiance may not be to everyone's liking.  I don't care.  When the food is this good, the rest of the world fades away and it's just you and the deliciousness.  Try it for yourself if you don't believe me.

THE BEST CHICKEN IN TOWN!  Now I've read reviews about the service and how long it takes...  Mrs White's is a hole in the wall place to eat where you feel like your neighbor is feeding you.  Very, very down to earth people you would sit down and have a beer with after a long day...  This place is not known for their fast service, like Capital Grill, they are known for their damn good food.  I don't know what they cook their green beans, but it's soooo good.  It reminds me of a fresh pot of pinto beans made with ham-hocks, amazing.  I recommend getting the chicken "smothered" or you will be picking off your friends plate for some gravy.  My second favorite side is the Mac and Cheese, let me top it off with some Koolaid! Again, if your looking for a place with fast service try elsewhere, but if your looking for some damn good food, this is the place that is worth the wait.

I loved this little restaurant. I was visiting my boyfriend for the weekend and googled this place. It had the best fried chicken we could ever want. It was really moist and juicy, but crispy. The service was good and consistent. If you want soul food that is mouth watering then this is the place. I will definitely return here in the future. Didn't have room for desserts, but I'm looking forward to the peach cobbler.
Greeeaaat food!  Nothing like southern home cooking.  Thank you Doris and Carlos for your hospitality

Drove into Phoenix today and headed straight to Mrs. White's.  It seems we were a bit early, and we had to wait outside while it opened.  An employee came outside while we were waiting to grab a smoke.  He was friendly and started up a bit of conversation with my husband about the place.  It turns out he was one of the cooks.

When were able to finally get in, we were offered drinks, and ended up getting sweet tea, which I don't care for.  I got the smothered pork chop and two sides, the mac and cheese and the black eyed peas.  

We got a corn cake to eat while we waited and when the meal came it was pipping hot and very good. Service was excellent and prices were reasonable.  I recommend this place for some true southern food.
This place is home.  The epitome of southern cooking.  The food is top notch.  The staff is friendly and very attentive.  So make yourself at home and stay a while.

So I admit I am a food network junkie and I honestly only went to this place because I saw it on best I ever ate fried chicken episode but come on best I ever ate fried chicken in Phoenix I had to see for myself.  

Well Mrs. White backed it up with some amazing chicken and I don't know what previous reviewers were talking about with the sides because my grandma from North Carolina was in town and her and I both liked the red beans and macaroni salad.  

The staff was friendly and even sent me home with two extra pieces of chicken for later.  This place is awesome and I will for sure be a repeat customer.

Also whoever said KFC has chicken as good and it's cheaper well keep going back to KFC and stay outta places like this cause you don't belong.  Just sayin'.  KFC aint got nothin on Mrs. White.

I'm from the south so I know good
Soul food. Not only is this great soul food but it's possibly the only way lace in phoenix that knows how to season food correctly. Don't let the decor turn you away. What they lack in ambiance, they make up for in flavor. This is a must go!

Came for lunch. Ordered fried chicken and pork chops. Mac and cheese, apple sauce, and rice with gravy. Sweet tea and koolaid. We may as we'll have licked our plates. Everything was absolutely delicious. And everyone working was so friendly and welcoming. Thank you!!!
The fried chicken is perfectly fried at Mrs. White's.  It's probably the best soul/southern food I've ever had!

I love getting my sooooul food on occasion. (Yes, I usually leave wearing a little of it too. I really should carry a bib with me.) 
On my last visit I decided to go with the catfish and I was craving veggies so I waited on some greens and I also decided to try the cabbage. The greens were tasty, the cabbage...I guess I was kind of expecting a sauted/fried cabbage with a little more flavor, it was good but a little bland. The catfish on the other hand was perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside moist on the inside and a nice big slab of it. Sooo good. 
I rarely pass up the Kool-Ade, but occasionally get the sweet tea. 

I have enjoyed my time there and usually go when I have plenty of time to enjoy my meal. While the food is served relatively quickly, I don't know that I would recommend it for someone looking for a quick downtown lunch time fix. For me if I am going to go enjoy some home cooking, I take my time and enjoy.

I had dinner here one night last week. The restaurant is located very close to Chase Field and has its own dedicated parking lot in back. There is also a rear entrance if you use the parking lot or you can walk around and come in the front door. I ordered the 3 piece fried chicken meal with sides of black eye peas and rice and brown gravy for about $13. The meal came out in about 15-20 minutes. The fried chicken was very good along with the peas and rice. I really enjoyed the meal. My only complaint was that I was given 2 wings and a thigh. I can understand 1 wing but not two.give me more meat! I mentioned that to the waitress and she agreed that the kitchen made a mistake and gave me my drink for free. 

I believe this is a very good soul food restaurant. The fried chicken is scrumptious and I recommend you try it. They have a dining room to eat in and the table service was friendly.

We drove all the way from north Scottsdale to try the legendary peach cobbler and voted best in the southwest southern comfort food. Server was a nice man who immediately greeted us and got our drink order. Wail waiting for our order to be taken we looked around the restaurant and noticed countless awards and magazine articles about the wonderful southern comfort food and we thought we had gone to the right place. Sadly all three of us received meals that made our tummies turn. Poor Mrs white would turn in her gave if she new what had happened to her souther food dream.The chicken sandwich is two pieces of small wings that is over breaded, dry, greasy, mostly bone fried chicken put on some dry bread with a side of your choice. Who put chicken wings on stale bread and calls it a sandwich? And the fresh caught catfish is a breaded and deep-fried disaster. The Mac and cheese was okay but could have been microwaved longer and the sweet potato were tasty but very sweet. However the black eye peas were a gummy mess and the cornbread was very disappointing and covered in grease. Not to mention wail eating the employees were cleaning around us, sweeping dust up, cleaning with dirty mop water, and washing their hands in the sanitizer water gross. However we decided to still stay and try out the peach cobbler that was award winning. Hahaha it was the worst soupy mess we had had. The dough tasted like undercooked frozen dumpling that was then covered in can peach soup and heated in the microwave. After all that the total came out to 50 bucks and 10 to the server not a meal worth 10. This place might have been good at some time but the reviews are very outdated. It is sad to say that the Kool aid was the best part of the meal.

I can't understand any review of less than a 5 for Mrs Whites! We love the food so much we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there!! Get the smothered chops and the rice with gravy - you won't regret it!

I've never actually stepped inside the place but I had a few take out meals brought to me by my folks over the years. Whenever I bit into a piece of fried chicken or breaded pork chop, I get an image of a motherly woman painstakingly cooking for a large family.

My order....Red Kool-aid, chicken, sweet potatoes,   mac n cheese and corn bread. Asked for honey and hot sauce on the side. Hubby ordered the cat fish, green beans and mac n cheese.  Verdict.....same as usual. ...it's fricken delicious. Love sitting at the counter where you can catch the smells of food cooked with love wafting from the kitchen. Pricy but with it.

I have been to Mrs. White's twice now and I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit.  My first time I ordered the cat fish.  It was good, but really needed to douse it in hot sauce to really enjoy it.  My husband ordered the smothered pork chops only because they didn't have any fried chicken available.  I was really bummed since the fried chicken was really all that I wanted.  Service is friendly and fairly quick.

On our second visit we had the fried chicken.  I'm hoping our first visit was a fluke because the flavor and crunch on their fried chicken is to die for! We also ordered oxtail, which I had only ever tried served in a peanut butter stew (Filipino dish).  Don't let the looks fool you.  Their oxtail is so flavorful and tender.  Deelish!  For sides I had rice with gravy and greens.  You have to order the greens as a side!  I think it compliments any of their entrees.  My husband was disappointed to find that they were out of okra on this visit.

It seems that there is always something not available when we go.  I'm not too bothered by it.  I think of it as someone's home kitchen.  You eat what's available and it's almost certainly going to be comforting and delicious.

I'm not really big into soul food, but someone told me to come try this restaurant. Legend has it that the owner found the restaurant back in the 1910's and has kept the family business for over a century. The restaurant isn't really big, but it is a good place to have lunch if you're on a work lunch break.

I had the fried chicken with spinach and a side of macaroni. The chicken did come with some seasoning flavor, which I thought added some flavor and kick to it. I was impressed with the way the steak was cooked, and it was tender. The spinach was also good, but the macaroni seemed a little bland. However, this was a good meal to have just for lunch.

There is also chicken served here, steak, potatoes, black eyed peas, and more delicious soul food here. My mother enjoyed it and I may now be on the hunt for more soul food places. I would say the service needed some work, but the food was spot on. I would definitely say to come try it if you have an hour to spare.

First, all lunches are $13.00 each plus $2.15 for drinks. Too expensive for lunch.  The green beans/potatos and rice wer very good.  Generous  quantities. 

the chicken was miserabe. over cooked, dry, the crust was almost without flavor,.  There no redeaming factors. If this is true soul food, I am not doing soul again.

OK This cafe surprised me. I rarely give 5 stars but I had to. 
They say it on the sign "great fried chicken and pork chops" and they are right. I loved it. 
I was never a fan of collard greens until today. These were not the best collard green I have ever ate but the best side dish I have ever eaten. I can't stop thinking about them. The deserts were to die for. I had 3. Yes 3 deserts. Bread pudding, peach cobbler, and banna pudding. All awesome. The fried chicken was one of the best and I have had many trips looking for the best fried chicken and to think I found this one by surprise. I like the way they serve you. It's called the golden rule because you tell the cashier what you ate and he pulls out some price from his head. Funny but it was fair. I did not care for the BBQ though. Sauce was great but the meat was not up to my standards. Braised not smoked. I think it should only be smoked with a dry rub. They do take credit but a charge is added.

Excellent food! Best food Southern you're going to find this side of the Mississippi

Try the sweet tea. I swear I go there just for the sweet tea and catfish alone

Big portions.  Really good chicken!  Not the best I've ever had but it's up there in top 3 for sure.  

Everything was nicely seasoned and the veggies were delish - I opted for the greens and the blackeyed peas.  I would actually consider the veggie plate and skip the meat because the sides were soooo good.

The cornbread was really, really good crumbled into the peas.  

Gargantuan size kool aid too!  A worthwhile stop!

Been coming here for a few months, but tonight was just perfect.  I always get the same thing - chicken fried steak (gravy is so bomb), cabbage, and red beans and rice.  Yum yum yum.  With a drink comes out to just under $17 - so worth it.  Staff has always been very friendly, and Mr. White is hilarious.

The food and atmosphere were perfect. We ordered standard southern comfort food and it was true to taste, not overly salty and sweet. It seems others have bad service but we were there during a weekend lunch rush and were seen in a timely fashion. It was fun reading the walls of all the famous people who had been there. My only complaint was that the bathroom wasn't air conditioned (it was July) so when I walked in, the stifling heat and "bathroom smell" hit me. Glad I'd already eaten! Will definitely go back when in the mood for collard greens and fried chicken.

Not only was the food amazing here. It was so great to have the story with a picture book told to us by our waitress. She was kind hearted. She loves her job you can tell. She told the story about the business with so much love and heart. The guy with all the tattoos like myself. It's amazing to see people not judging him and he loves his job as well. We own Rusk Lock & Key. And I run the marketing team for my husbands locksmith business and it's hard to work not knowing if people are going to judge with tattoo like myself. And I find it very cool to see businesses hiring people with tattos. Because he cares about his job. Thats the type of people you want working for you

Although I'm happy I checked this place out, I'll probably never be back. The atmosphere is fun and casual and I kept feeling like I was at a diner in Memphis. The server was extremely friendly (although she forgot to bring my husband's drink even after numerous reminders). The menu is very limited. Usually I can respect a place with a limited menu because they typically do the few things they offer very well. Not so here. We had a group of about 7 and all ordered different items. The only thing that unanimously received praise were the porkchops and sweet potatoes. The mac and cheese, corn bread, and chicken all needed seasoning.

This is probably the best fried chicken i have ever eaten in my life. I dont know what they put in the breading but it is so crispy and addicting. I ordered the fried chicken with mac and cheese, green beans and rice and gravy. I think everything complemented each other and I am so eager to come back to try the catfish. True southern comfort food. $16.47 for the entree with a drink. Cant wait to return.

The food is sooo good... it makes you want to take a nap afterwards....The service was fantastic... They give very large portions ... I had to take half of my food home... I had the smothered pork chops, mac and cheese and green beans.... the Cafe reminds me of being at someone's home in the south with Southern hospitality.... It was a very sociable environment I really enjoyed my lunch there ... I didn't want to go back to work

Stopped by last week.. first one in the door. I had fried chicken with greens/potatoes and buttered cabbage...I had a bowl of their creamy gravy on the side and dipped chicken pieces. The gravy went so well with everything that I ended up smothering everything. Came with freshly baked cornbread. 

Excellent meal.. Try the smothered pork chops.. or the Ox Tails. Lots of side dishes

It's simple to order, look at the mural on the wall. No checks, just tell the cashier what you had on the way out. 

Smothered chicken (two large pieces) cost $14. Entrees come with two sides and corn bread. Fast service. Mrs. White (in her 90s) still bakes pies for the restaurant... try the peach.

Her son, Lolo, has branched out and has three upscale restaurants scattered around the Valley: Lolo's Chicken and Waffles.

My first time visiting this establishment, and wow what a place. This place lives up to it's to it's reputation for soul food! I enjoyed the chicken fried steak, with a side of collar greens, corn bread, and a fresh glass of lemonade to wash it down. I noticed alot of writing on the walls from some famous people, and I enjoyed the overall spirit of this place. Taylor greeted my uncle and myself, and quickly helped us find a booth to sit at. Carlos brought our food to us, and I was highly impressed at his soft nature and beautiful attitude. I am sold on this great place, and will definitely make an effort to visit this awesome place, whenever I visit phoenix!! Kudos to the whole  Mrs. White' s team!!

The Service from the waiters is below average ... they are not polite at all, they are nonchalant about issues patrons had with their food wait times... I even heard the waiter argue  with a table saying he's just the waiter and not the cook. the Mac n cheese is artificial and NOT homemade and looks and tastes identical to KFC Mac n cheese, it's Super yellow in color which would not be the case had it been homemade. I'm southern and the food is subpar. The yams were dry, the greens were ok there was no meat in them though ... the catfish was great though... And it was hot as hell in there...I know it's cooling down outside but the place is tiny and packed... I'm from the south so this place did not meet my expectations by far.

First time today for lunch. First class fried chicken. Best I've had for a long time. Mac and cheese and fried okra very good. Slaw was good but needed a bit more sugar and then it would have excellent. Like the touch of Kool Aide, nice on a hot day.

This place is uber casual. Service was very good and friendly. Will defiantly be back.

There's something about Mrs. White's that no other place has.  It's not something you can bottle up and sell.  It's the love they put into every meal.

I have to tell you... when a friend suggested we go to Mrs. White's yesterday when our plans were changed, I was ecstatic.  I had not been in quite awhile.  I could already imagine myself eating those green beans and potatoes, sweet potatoes and fried chicken.  

Once we got there, that is exactly what I ordered!  

I could tell, too, that my chicken was made with an extra side of love.  It was phenomenal.  

The people that don't like Mrs. White's don't get it.  I heard a lady complaining yesterday about how long her food was taking.  It kind of made me smirk.  Food this good is cooked to order... and takes time.  I knew it would be a long wait for our food, but I wasn't on a lunch hour.  I feel like anyone who is on a lunch hour might be better served hitting Mrs. White's another time.  

The people there are all great.  If you take the time to talk to the people who work there, you will see how nice they are.  We got to talk to "Wink" about how he got his nickname from his grandma in St. Louis.  I told him about how I got my nick name, too.  

I love Mrs. White's and I hope to visit again soon.

Wanted to eat here for a long time, was not disappointed. Large portions, great comfort food the way it is suppose to be. Shared the Moist Pork Chops, Fried Catfish, Fried Chicken. The sides are great also, cornbread, potato salad and mac & cheese and of course kool aid. We were fortunate there was no wait and also had parking available. The portions were very generous and actually made 2 1/2 meals. The staff was friendly and very helpful on deciding what to order. Can't wait to go back. You have to try this iconic place.
